title: 105_hr4093
content: The "Hospital Stay Protection Act" is cited as the short title. It establishes a standard relating to hospital lengths of stay for group health plans under the Public Health Service Act. The "Hospital Stay Protection Act" requires group health plans to provide inpatient coverage for a medically appropriate period determined by a physician in consultation with the patient. It prohibits denying eligibility based on coverage requirements and penalizing providers for following the act. The "Hospital Stay Protection Act" mandates reimbursement for providers who offer care to patients as per the act, prohibits incentivizing shorter inpatient stays, and requires preauthorization for stay length. It also establishes an appeals process and penalties for plan violations, along with notice compliance requirements. The Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 is amended to include new requirements related to plan notice compliance and conforming amendments to sections 2704 and 2706. SEC. 713. STANDARDS FOR HOSPITAL LENGTHS OF STAY. Group health plans and health insurance issuers must provide inpatient coverage for a medically appropriate period determined by a physician. They are prohibited from denying eligibility based on coverage requirements, penalizing providers for following these guidelines, or offering incentives to patients. The Secretary will establish an appeals process and penalty for plans or issuers that violate the provisions of this section, treating it as a material modification in the terms of the plan for notice purposes. The Secretary will establish an appeals process and penalty for plans or issuers that violate the provisions of this section, treating it as a material modification in the terms of the plan for notice purposes. Conforming and clerical amendments are made to sections 731(c) and 732(a) of the Act, along with updates to the table of contents. "Sec. 713. Standard for hospital lengths of stay. Individual Health Insurance - Subpart 3 of part B of title XXVII of the Public Health Service Act is amended by adding a new section: SEC. 2752. STANDARDS FOR HOSPITAL LENGTHS OF STAY." The provisions of section 2706 apply to health insurance coverage in the individual market. Health insurance issuers must comply with notice requirements similar to group health plans. Section 2762 is amended to include additional sections. Effective dates for group market reforms are specified. The amendments made by subsections (a) and (b) to section 300gg-62(b)(2) apply to plan years starting on or after January 1, 1999. For group health plans under collective bargaining agreements, the amendments do not apply to plan years before the last agreement relating to the plan. The amendments apply to plan years starting on or after January 1, 1999, and do not apply to plan years before the last collective bargaining agreement relating to the plan. Amendments made by subsection (b) apply to health insurance in the individual market. The amendments made by subsection (b) apply to health insurance coverage in the individual market starting on or after January 1, 1999. Section 104(1) of the Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act of 1996 is amended to coordinate regulations with other relevant laws.
